author: dlr
msg: Made note of the new org.apache.xmlrpc.AuthenticationFailed class and

author: dlr
msg: An interface used to mark authentication failures.  For instance, a
class might implement this interface and sub-class
java.security.acl.AclNotFoundException to indicate that a user does
not exist, providing an appropriate message via the getMessage() API.

author: dlr
msg: Noted update to recent XmlWriter changes.

author: dlr
msg: Added John Wilson to developers list.

author: dlr
msg: chardata(): Characters out of range for the XML spec won't be written
as XML to avoid parse errors on the client side.  Instead, an
exception will be thrown.  This was originally noted by John Wilson
<tug@wilson.co.uk>, with this follow up by Adam Megacz
> Ah, the joys of the self-contradictory XML-RPC spec ;)
>   "Any characters are allowed in a string except < and &... A string can
>    be used to encode binary data."
> Dave absolutely refuses to fix or clarify this.
